snippet: The streaming-video Web site had been seeking bids for months. The owners — 21st Century Fox, the Walt Disney Company and NBCUniversal — instead decided not to sell.
abstract: Companies that mutually own Hulu, 21st Century Fox, Walt Disney Company and NBC Universal, agree to forgo plans to sell company; will instead make new investment of $750 million and use Hulu's technology to compete against other online distributors like Netflix.

byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The streaming-video Web site had been seeking bids for months. The owners — 21st Century Fox, the Walt Disney Company and NBCUniversal — instead decided not to sell.

headline.main: Hulu Owners Call Off Sale, Instead Pledging to Invest to Take On Rivals
headline.print_headline: Hulu Owners Call Off Sale, Instead Pledging to Invest to Take On Rivals
